article.headline: Loyola, Md. 83, Vermont 79
article.story: BALTIMORE (AP) -- Marquis Sullivan scored 27 points, including seven 3-pointers, and Omari Isreal added 17 to lift Loyola, Md. to an 83-79 victory over Vermont on Sunday. Vermont's Colin McIntosh missed an open 3-pointer from the right wing with 2.5 seconds left, and Brett Harvey made both free throws to seal the Greyhounds' victory. Marqus Blakely scored a game-high 30 points and Mike Trimboli chipped in with 14 points and nine assists for the Catamounts (0-3). Loyola (3-1) was 12-for-23 from the 3-point line to win its third consecutive game. Sullivan hit a 3-pointer from the right wing to give Loyola a 68-65 lead with 8:20 left in regulation, and he nailed a long jumper from the top of the key to tie his previous career-high, 24 points. Sullivan hit his seventh 3-pointer with five minutes remaining, and Harvey followed with his third 3 to put the Greyhounds ahead, 76-69. Harvey was 3-for-3 beyond the arc and finished with 13 points. Trimboli sank a 15-foot jumper to cut the Catamounts' deficit to 80-79 with 10.4 seconds left. Blakely used his fifth foul on Gerald Brown with 8.9 seconds to play. Brown missed his first free throw but made his second give Loyola an 81-79 lead.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
